channel.title: Bangalore News: Latest Bangalore News Headlines & Live News Updates from Bangalore - Times of India
channel.description: Bangalore news live: TOI brings the latest Bangalore news headlines about Bangalore crime, Bangalore education news, Bangalore real estate news, Bangalore politics and Live Updates on local Bangalore news from Times of India

image.title: Bangalore News: Latest Bangalore News Headlines & Live News Updates from Bangalore - Times of India

item.title: Cops deny permission for ‘Marathi Mahamelava’
item.description: Police denied permission to the ‘Marathi Mahamelava’ (Marathi convention), organised by the Maharashtra Ekikaran Samiti (MES) at the Vaccine Depot Ground in Tilakwadi on Monday and detained leaders, including MES working president and former MLA Manohar Kinekar, former mayor Shivaji Sunthakar, RI Patil, Prakash Maragale who were marching towards the event spot.

item.title: 1 held for trying to extort fish bizman in B'luru
item.description: Banaswadi police on Sunday arrested a 25-year-old for allegedly threatening a fish stall owner with a machete and demanding money.

item.title: Handloom fair till December 25 in Mysuru
item.description: A handloom fair, titled Nanna Kaimagga, Nanna Hemme, will be on till December 25 at JSS Urban Haat.

item.title: Good response to Mandya bandh call by farmers
item.description: The bandh call given by Raitha Sangha, and other organisations demanding fair price to sugarcane, Rs.40 per liter of milk supplied to KMF, waiver of various electricity bill disrupted normal life in the district.

item.title: Security stepped up across Belagavi
item.description: Due to concerns about the border dispute with Maharashtra and potential disruptions from protests by various groups, Belagavi city has been put on high alert as the winter session of the Karnataka Legislature begins on Monday. The city has a heavy security presence, resembling a military cantonment.

item.title: 4 held for sale of e-cigarettes in Bengaluru
item.description: Ashokanagar police on Wednesday raided four shops on Brigade Road, Richmond Road, and Residency Road and detained four people for allegedly selling e-cigarettes in the Central Business District.

item.title: Deploying defective bus is negligence, says HC
item.description: Deploying a mechanically defective bus on road to carry passengers is nothing but an act of gross negligence, the high court has observed, while directing the state-owned Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) to pay Rs 1.3 lakh as compensation to a government school teacher.

item.title: Boy accidentally shot as brother fiddles with gun
item.description: A seven-year-old boy having his lunch collapsed on his plate and died after he was hit by a bullet fired accidentally from an illegal firearm his elder brother had found and was playing with in a farmhouse in Kadushivanahalli village, near Kanakapura in Ramanagara district, on Friday.

item.title: Poodle refused entry on flight at B'luru airport
item.description: Despite clearing all procedures, a pet poodle was denied boarding on an Air India flight at Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) after the flight captain objected to its cage and muzzle. While the pet parents - a family of three - cancelled their travel, the airline's ground crew said the passengers were given the option of boarding the next flight to Delhi after the cage and muzzle issues were fixed, but they refused.

item.title: Faceoff over anti-halal bill likely in Belagavi session
item.description: The winter session of legislature starting in Belagavi on Monday is likely to witness a fresh faceoff between BJP and Congress over the plan to introduce an anti-halal bill. BJP MLC N Ravikumar has taken the initiative to bring the bill that seeks to ban food certification by any institution other than the Food Safety and Security Association of India (FSSAI).

item.title: K'taka HC fastens liability onus on insurance cos
item.description: Unless it is established that the insured has been informed about policy cancellation, the insurer cannot avoid the statutory liability of payment of compensation, more so in the case of third parties, the Karnataka HC has held in a recent judgment.

item.title: Railways will soon give land for B'luru suburban rail
item.description: Union railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday said Indian Railways would hand over land for Bengaluru suburban rail project in a few days.

item.title: Shiv Sena MP not allowed to visit Belagavi for protest
item.description: The district administration has prohibited the entry of Shiv Sena Member of Parliament Dhairyasheel Mane to the Belagavi city to take part in an event organised by Madhyavarti Maharashtra Ekikaran Samiti (MMES) on Monday.

item.title: Mangaluru blast accused shifted to B'luru hospital
item.description: Mohammed Shariq, prime accused in the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case, was shifted to Bengaluru on Saturday.

item.title: MLA Nanjegowda convicted in cheque-bounce case
item.description: The special court for cases involving MPs/MLAs from Karnataka has convicted Malur legislator KY Nanjegowda in a cheque-bounce case.

item.title: In Bengaluru, Absolute alcohol saves man's heart
item.description: Consumption of liquor may be frowned upon but its essential ingredient, alcohol, in its highly potent form has helped save a 30-year-old man's heart and life.

item.title: Lumpy disease: No Cattle trade in Mysuru till Jan 10
item.description: With lumpy skin disease (LSD) causing cattle deaths, the Mysuru district administration has prohibited cattle trade in the weekly markets. It has also restricted the interstate movement of cattle until January 10.

item.title: 11th C inscriptions found at abandoned Jain temple
item.description: Three Kannada inscriptions dated to the 11th century have been discovered in an abandoned Jain temple at Doddakanagal village in Kodagu's Somawarpet taluk. The temple itself was rediscovered a few decades ago. While searching for an inscription that has been documented at the same village, Nitin HP, an associate director at Wipro and an amateur historian, stumbled upon the three inscriptions.

item.title: Shot at, Mysuru Dasara elephant Balarama recovering
item.description: Dasara elephant Balarama, a member of Mathigod elephant camp, who suffered pellet injuries after an estate owner opened fire at him on Thursday night, is recovering and responding to treatment, said foresters.He is on antibiotics and under observation.

item.title: K'taka: Video of women sharing bed in hosp goes viral
item.description: A video clip of two women patients seen sleeping on a single bed at Tiptur government hospital, 170km from Bengaluru, went viral on Saturday, triggering terse reactions from netizens with regard to the quality of public healthcare.
